ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: The boat to Kunark
ygData.msgSnippet: I have been in the Dreadlands and it isn t so bad, I haven t had much trouble finding groups as a ranger because we have SOW and there aren t many druids or
ygData.messageBody:
I have been in the Dreadlands and it isn't so bad, I haven't had much trouble finding groups as a ranger because we have SOW and there aren't many druids or shaman around usually. I have been asked to tank and pull occasionally which is alright, but I prefer a warrior, shadowknight or monk to pull whenever possible, they just seem better at it, tracking is kind of useless in a crowded zone as whatever you are tracking might be taken by another player or group.
 
----- Original Message -----
From: bigmaca3
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, July 12, 2002 10:17 AM
Subject: [EverQuest] Re: The boat to Kunark

--- In EverQuest@y..., "mlockridge01" <MLockridge01@c...> wrote:
> The other day I decided that a trip to Kunark was in order for my
> druid. I will be needing Brute hides, and so was ready to go and
hunt
> them. However, the shuttles in Butcherblock never met the boat. I
> tried three times, three different shuttles, and they went out to
> Timerous Deep, got close to the boat, then the boat left. The
> shuttles just went back to BB.
>
> That avenue being out, I returned to SK to pick off gnolls, and
> forage Plains Pebbles. I almost have my bank tool box full of them.
> have about eight to go. So, decided to stay there until I get the
> rest.
>
> Plus I have been getting fs weapons from the gnolls, which I have
> tried to make into another Vale Sewing Kit to sell.
>
> Hope they get the boat fixed. For my first trip I want to do it the
> old-fashioned way.
>
> Barto Proudfoot

I've found the big boat to FV to be broken too.  Luckily I have a
friend that's a Druid so I got a port to the DL.  I tried to petition
the GM but it doesn't work if there isn't one on!

Kunark is a dangerous place for the good races.  The only place you
can bind a good melee is in FV and it's surrounded by mid-level
mobs.  If you port over you end up in the DL, which is ok, it's just
getting out of there that's the problem!  The DL does have
connections to the FM and FV if you know where to look.  It's not a
place to be without a map!

And I am also looking for a place to take me to the mid-40's.  I've
been to the moon, Kunark, the Karanas and Velious.  I like to go to
the zones that have been abandoned, like all the dungones on
Anatonica.  I'm in the FM now and will probably be in the DL, like
everyone else.

Tuldayen Grimblade
37th Season Ranger of Tunare
Teris-Thule
